<dialog height="506" icon="PRPT" id="PRPTS" left="279" top="4" width="420"><readpanel fill="b" id="PRPTBOX" nl="1" scroll="v" text="Parameters"><properties><entry name="text">Parameters</entry><entry name="modifiable">0</entry></properties><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_QUERY_SWs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Query installed Software" tooltip="Define the name of the sofware to query." upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Query installed Software</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_QUERY_SWs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Define the name of the sofware to query.</entry><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text><combo dynamic="0" enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_LEVELs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Select by Level" tooltip="This parameter lets you list all software objects down to the specified level: bundle: Shows only bundles product: Shows only products subproduct: Shows products and subproducts fileset: Shows products, subproducts and filesets file: Shows products, subproducts, filesets, files and numbers category: Shows all categories of available patches for patches that have included category objects in their definition Implementation: you may use the -l option at command line" alt="1" filter="0" strict="1" vtype="i"><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command owner="_self" owneraction="setsource" ownerparam="src|_dialog@src"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptcombolist" target="_self" targetaction="setlist" wait="0"/><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC4_RV.PM_HPUX.QUERY_LEVEL</entry><entry name="text">Select by Level</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_LEVELs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">This parameter lets you list all software objects down to the specified level:
bundle: Shows only bundles
product: Shows only products
subproduct: Shows products and subproducts
fileset: Shows products, subproducts and filesets
file: Shows products, subproducts, filesets, files and numbers
category: Shows all categories of available patches for patches that have included category objects in their definition
Implementation: you may use the -l option at command line</entry><entry name="dynamic">0</entry><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></combo><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_SHOWN_ATTR_LISTs.00" inputassistance="1" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Attributes shown" tooltip="list of attributes to show for the queried entities. The following values are available: architecture: Describes the target system(s) supported by the product category: type of software mod_time: Production time for a distribution media instance_id: Uniquely identifies this software product title: Long/official name for the object mode: permission mode of the file mtime: last modification time for the file owner: owner of file path: full pathname for the file revision: revision number for an object size: size in bytes; reflets the size of all contained filesetzs state: current state of the fileset Implementation note: at the command line, the list of attributes are mapped to the parameter -x one_liner="&UC4RB_SHOWN_ATTR_LIST#"" upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Attributes shown</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_SHOWN_ATTR_LISTs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">1</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">list of attributes to show for the queried entities. The following values are available:
architecture: Describes the target system(s) supported by the product
category: type of software
mod_time: Production time for a distribution media
instance_id: Uniquely identifies this software product
title: Long/official name for the object
mode: permission mode of the file
mtime: last modification time for the file
owner: owner of file
path: full pathname for the file
revision: revision number for an object
size: size in bytes; reflets the size of all contained filesetzs
state: current state of the fileset
Implementation note: at the command line, the list of attributes are mapped to the parameter -x one_liner="&UC4RB_SHOWN_ATTR_LIST#"</entry><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_DEPOTs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Alternate depot" tooltip="Per default you can list all software that is packaged, stored, and ready to be installed. Setting this option pointing to a depot lets you list software residing on the default depot on your local host. Examples: List the contents of a local tape depot, &UC4RB_DEPOT# = /dev/rmt/0 List the products stored in the software depot on host1 located at /swmedia: &UC4RB_DEPOT# = host1:/swmedia Implementation note: -d @ &UC4RB_DEPOT# can be used at command line. Option is only generated if parameter is not null.Per default you can list all software that is packaged, stored, and ready to be installed. Setting this option pointing to a depot lets you list software residing on the default depot on your local host. Examples: List the contents of a local tape depot, &UC4RB_DEPOT# = /dev/rmt/0 List the products stored in the software depot on host1 located at /swmedia: &UC4RB_DEPOT# = host1:/swmedia Implementation note: -d @ &UC4RB_DEPOT# can be used at command line. Option is only generated if parameter is not null." upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Alternate depot</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_DEPOTs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Per default you can list all software that is packaged, stored, and ready to be installed.
Setting this option pointing to a depot lets you list software residing on the default depot on your local host.
Examples:
List the contents of a local tape depot, &UC4RB_DEPOT# = /dev/rmt/0
List the products stored in the software depot on host1 located at /swmedia: &UC4RB_DEPOT# = host1:/swmedia
Implementation note: -d @ &UC4RB_DEPOT# can be used at command line. Option is only generated if parameter is not null.Per default you can list all software that is packaged, stored, and ready to be installed.
Setting this option pointing to a depot lets you list software residing on the default depot on your local host.
Examples:
List the contents of a local tape depot, &UC4RB_DEPOT# = /dev/rmt/0
List the products stored in the software depot on host1 located at /swmedia: &UC4RB_DEPOT# = host1:/swmedia
Implementation note: -d @ &UC4RB_DEPOT# can be used at command line. Option is only generated if parameter is not null.</entry><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text><dynradiogroup enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_REMOVE_COMMENTSs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Remove comments from output" tooltip="Depending upon with which parameters the query is executed, the output of swlist may contain empty lines and lines with comments (e.g. "swlist -l fileset" also reports products/subproducts separately). Default is to supress those lines." alt="1" required="0"><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.VARA.YES_NO</entry><entry name="text">Remove comments from output</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_REMOVE_COMMENTSs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Depending upon with which parameters the query is executed, the output of swlist may contain empty lines and lines with comments (e.g. "swlist -l fileset" also reports products/subproducts separately). Default is to supress those lines.</entry><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="customfield"/></properties></dynradiogroup></readpanel></dialog>

PROMPTSETDATA.DATAEDITOR: <PRPTS ontop="1"><PRPTBOX><UC4RB_QUERY_SWs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="UC4RB_QUERY_SW#" ReadFromTable="OPSE"></UC4RB_QUERY_SWs.00><UC4RB_LEVELs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="UC4RB_LEVEL#" ReadFromTable="OPSE">bundle</UC4RB_LEVELs.00><UC4RB_SHOWN_ATTR_LISTs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="UC4RB_SHOWN_ATTR_LIST#" ReadFromTable="OPSE">revision title</UC4RB_SHOWN_ATTR_LISTs.00><UC4RB_DEPOTs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="UC4RB_DEPOT#" ReadFromTable="OPSE"></UC4RB_DEPOTs.00><UC4RB_REMOVE_COMMENTSs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="UC4RB_REMOVE_COMMENTS#" ReadFromTable="OPSE">YES</UC4RB_REMOVE_COMMENTSs.00></PRPTBOX></PRPTS>
